parameters.description: The first date of the interval within the period. Format YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: The last date of the interval within the selected period. Format YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: includeUnposted
parameters.description: Checkmark indicating if unposted batches are included.

parameters.name: includeUnreleased
parameters.description: Checkmark indicating if unreleased (balanced) batches are included.

parameters.name: skipRecords
parameters.description: This field has been deprecated and will be removed in future versions. Use pagenumber and pagesize for pagination purposes. Pagenumber and pagesize does not work with NumberToRead and SkipRecords.

parameters.name: numberToRead
parameters.description: This field has been deprecated and will be removed in future versions. Use pagenumber and pagesize for pagination purposes. Pagenumber and pagesize does not work with NumberToRead and SkipRecords.

parameters.name: lastModifiedDateTime
parameters.description: System retrieved information for last modified date and time. Valid date/time format is yyyy-MM-dd, yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss or yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.FFF. FFF stands for milliseconds.

parameters.name: lastModifiedDateTimeCondition
parameters.description: Value to be used for filtering lastModifiedDateTime value.

parameters.name: expandAccountInfo
parameters.description:
By default, if no value is provided, False and the account information will include only Number, Description, Type and GlConsolAccountCD.
If True, each transaction returned will include extended information about account.

parameters.name: expandBranchInfo
parameters.description:
By default, if no value is provided, False and branch information will include only branch number.
If True, each transaction returned will include extended information about Branch (number and name).

parameters.name: includeTransactionBalance
parameters.description:
By default, if no value is provided, False and the transactions returned will not include their balances (fields BegBalance, EndingBalance, CurrBegBalance, CurrEndingBalance)
If True, each transaction returned will include its balance.

parameters.description: Pagination parameter. Page number.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description:
Pagination parameter. Number of items to be collected.
Please use a page size lower or equal to the allowed max page size which is returned as part of the metadata information.
If requested page size is greater than allowed max page size, request will be limited to max page size.

Get a range of Journal Transactions - ScreenId=GL301000. 
On this particular endpoint, pagesize and totalcount denotes number of journaltransaction lines. 
When using pagination, the transactions for one specific batch can be split into several responses. 
Please use a page size lower or equal to the allowed max page size which is returned under metadata. 
If pagesize is greater than the max page size, it will be limited to max page size.

parameters.name: periodId
parameters.description: Financial Period to query data for. Mandatory if 'LastModifiedDateTime' not provided. Format: YYYYPP

parameters.name: lastModifiedDateTime
parameters.description:
When setting this parameter there will be exported only the batches changed or created since the provided date and time. 
Mandatory if 'PeriodId' is not provided. 
Format: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss

parameters.name: module
parameters.description: Module to query data for. Allowed values: GL, AP, AR, CM, CA, IN, DR, FA, PM

If false there will be exported the batches having Released flag on false. 
If not set no filtering based on Released flag is applied

id.description: Identifies a started background API operation

status.description: Current status of a background API operation. Possible values are 'Started', 'Finished' and 'Failed'.

statusCode.description: The Http Status Code of the finished background API operation. Value is 0 when operation is not done.

receivedUtc.description: Time when background API operation was requested

startedUtc.description: Time when processing of background API operation was started

finishedUtc.description: Time when background API operation was finished processing

webhookAddress.description: The webhook uri used to notify when background API operation is finished, or 'none' if no notification is configured

errorMessage.description: Any error message during processing of background API operation request. Note that any error response from the actual endpoint can be obtained by calling the ContentLocation address from the webhook notifaction response or the background state document.

originalUri.description: The endpoint that was requested to be processed as a background API operation.

hasResponseContent.description: Indicates whether or not the background API operation ended with a response content. Value is updated only when background API operation is finished.

hasRequestContent.description: Indicates whether or not the background API operation request has a request content.

contentLocation.description: The uri from where the client can get the response from the background API operation, if any is available.

responseHeaders.description: Any response headers from the finished background API operation.

unitPrice.description:
Unit price > The unit price set for the item or service. If you want to update the unit price
automatically to the current value(that is, the applicable sales or default price),
you can use the Recalculate Prices and Discounts action.If you have modified
the unit price and saved the document, the value will not be updated by the
system if you change the document date.

unitPriceInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Unit price in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

manualAmount.description: Manual amount > a check box indicating that the amount has been entered manually.

manualAmountInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Manual amount in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

amount.description:
Amount > The amount after the discount has been applied. The value of this read-only box
is calculated automatically by deducting the discount amount from the extended price.

cost.description:
Cost > The total cost of the line in default currency. 
The value will always be 0 for unreleased documents.

amountInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Amount in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

uom.description: UoM > The unit of measure (UoM) for the item.

discountPercent.description:
Discount percent > The percent of the line-level discount that has been applied manually or
automatically.The system selects the Manual Discount check box and
calculates the discount amount after you have entered the percent manually and
saved your changes or added a new line.

discountAmount.description:
Discount amount > The amount of the line-level discount that has been applied manually or
automatically to this line.The system selects the Manual Discount check box
and calculates the line amount after you have entered the discount amount
manually and save your changes or added a new line.

discountAmountInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Discount amount in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

manualDiscount.description:
Manual discount > A check box that indicates (if selected) that the discount has been applied
manually.If you clear the check box, the system clears entered discount percent,
or discount amount, or selected discount code.

deferralCode.description:
The deferral code assigned to the stock item or non-stock item specified in this
document line.Upon release of the document, the system generates a deferral
schedule (or schedules) based on the settings defined in this deferral code.

discountCode.description: The code of the line discount that has been applied to this line automatically or manually.

CashSaleDto.description: This class represents a invoice in InvoiceController. Used by getting data.

hold.description: The top part > Hold > A check box that indicates (if selected) that the document is a draft. A document with the On Hold status may be edited and cannot be released.

discountTotal.description: The top part > Discount total > The document discount total.

discountTotalInCurrency.description: The top part > Discount total > The document discount total in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in a another currency than your default.

detailTotal.description: The top part > Detail total > The document total, which the system calculates for all line items in the Document details tab.

detailTotalInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Detail total in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in a another currency than your default.

vatTaxableTotal.description: The top part > VAT taxable total > The document total that is subjected to VAT.

vatTaxableTotalInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the VAT taxable total in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in a another currency than your default.

vatExemptTotal.description: The top part > VAT exempt. total > The document total that is exempt from VAT. This total is calculated as the taxable amount for the tax with the Include in VAT Exempt Total check box selected on the Taxes form.This box is available only if the VAT Reporting feature is enabled in your system.

vatExemptTotalInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the VAT exempt. total in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in a another currency than your default.

salesPersonID.description: The field is deprecated for customer document endpoints, please use SalesPerson instead

salesPersonDescr.description: The field is deprecated for customer document endpoints, please use SalesPerson instead

paymentReference.description: ///The top part > Payment ref. > The reference number of the document, as automatically generated by the system in accordance with the number series assigned to cash sales in the Customer ledger preferences window..

documentType.description: The top part > Type > The document type. The following types are available: invoice, debit note, credit note, overdue charge, credit write-off

referenceNumber.description: The Top part > Ref. no. > The reference number of the customer ledger document in the system.

postPeriod.description: The top part > Post period > The period to which the document should be posted. Format YYYYMM.

financialPeriod.description: The financial period to which the transactions recorded in the document should be posted. Format YYYYMM.

documentDate.description:
The top part > Date* > The date when the customer ledger document was created.
By default, for a new document, it is the current business date, but you can change the date.

origInvoiceDate.description:
The top part > Orig invoice date > The date based on which the Due date and Cash discount date is calculated. Only used if setting "Use Orig Invoice Date" is active in AR Preferences.
By default, for a new document, it is the current business date, but you can change the date.

status.description: The top part > Status > The status of the document, which can be one of the following: Hold, Balanced, Voided, Scheduled, Open, Closed, Pending print, Pending email.

currencyId.description: The top part > Currency > The currency of the document. By default, it is the customer???s default currency,but it can be changed if the Allow Currency Override check box is selected in the AR303000 window.

amount.description:
The top part > Amount > The amount paid by the document. The value appears for new documents if the Validate document totals on entry check box is selected on the AR101000 window.
If the check box is cleared, then the value appears when the document status is Open.

amountInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Amount in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in a another currency than your default.

balance.description:
The top part > Balance > For an open customer ledger document, the balance after any cash discount was taken. 
For a document used in the application process, this is the balance after the payments were applied.

balanceInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Balance in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in a another currency than your default.

cashDiscount.description: The top part > Cash discount > The cash discount amount that has been or will be taken on the document, which the system calculates based on the specified credit terms.

cashDiscountInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Cash discount in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

customerRefNumber.description: The top part > External reference > The external reference used in AutoInvoice.

invoiceText.description: The top part > Invoice text > Any user-provided description of the customer ledger document.

lastModifiedDateTime.description: System generated field for last modification date/time of document.

createdDateTime.description: The Attachments tab > Creation time > The date the attachment was created.

note.description: Icon Notes on top of the window > Pop-up window for providing any user-defined text connected to the document.

vatTotal.description: The top part > VAT total > The VAT amount of the document, as defined on the VAT details tab.

vatTotalInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the VAT total in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in a another currency than your default.

cashAccount.description: Financial details tab > The payment information section > Cash account > The cash account associated with the payment method.

customerProject.description: The top part > Customer project no. > The customer project no. used in AutoInvoice.

postPeriodInCashSaleUpdateDto.description: The financial period to which the transactions recorded in the document should be posted. Use the format MMYYYY.

financialPeriodInCashSaleUpdateDto.description: The financial period to which the transactions recorded in the document should be posted. Use the format YYYYMM.

salesPersonIDInCashSaleUpdateDto.description: The field is deprecated for customer document endpoints, please use Salesperson instead

salespersonInCashSaleUpdateDto.description: The identifier of the salesperson involved.

documentType.description: The field is deprecated for specific customer document endpoints. It will only be usable from customer document endpoint.

released.description: Parameter for showing if invoice has been released or not.

dunningLevel.description: The dunning level of the document.

closedFinancialPeriod.description: The date of the closing of the financial period.

dunningLetterDateTime.description: The date and time for when the document last released a dunning letter.

dunningLetterDateTimeCondition.description: Set time/date as before (<), after (>), before and including (=<) OR after and including (=>) to filter on time frame.

project.description: The project with which the document is associated.

expandApplications.description: True if you want to see all dunning information regarding this document.

expandAttachments.description: True if you want to see all attachments regarding this document.

expandTaxDetails.description: True if you want to see all VAT details regarding this document.

expandInvoiceAddress.description: True if you want to see all information regarding the invoice address for this document.

financialPeriod.description: The financial period to which the transactions recorded in the document is posted. Format YYYYMM.

documentDueDate.description: The date when payment for the document is due, in accordance with the credit terms.

status.description: The status of the document. Use the dropdown to select status.

numberToRead.description: This field has been deprecated and will be removed in future versions. Use pagenumber and pagesize for pagination purposes. Pagenumber and pagesize does not work with NumberToRead and SkipRecords.

skipRecords.description: This field has been deprecated and will be removed in future versions. Use pagenumber and pagesize for pagination purposes. Pagenumber and pagesize does not work with NumberToRead and SkipRecords.

externalReference.description: The top part > External reference > The external reference used in AutoInvoice.

paymentReference.description: The top part > Payment ref. > The reference number of the document, as automatically generated by the system in accordance with the number series assigned to cash sales in the Customer ledger preferences window..

customerRefNumber.description: The top part > External reference > The external reference used in AutoInvoice.

greaterThanValue.description: Greater than value. The item which is the object for this, varies from API to API.

lastModifiedDateTime.description: System generated value for last modification of transaction/record. Use format: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM (date and time) to filter from date to present.

createdDateTime.description: Creation date and time.

pageSize.description:
Pagination parameter. Number of items to be collected.
Please use a page size lower or equal to the allowed max page size which is returned as part of the metadata information.
If requested page size is greater than allowed max page size, request will be limited to max page size.

quantity.description: Quantity > The quantity of items (goods or services) of a particular type sold to the customer.

unitPrice.description:
Unit price > The unit price set for the item or service. If you want to update the unit price
automatically to the current value(that is, the applicable sales or default price),
you can use the Recalculate Prices and Discounts action.If you have modified
the unit price and saved the document, the value will not be updated by the
system if you change the document date.

unitPriceInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Unit price in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

manualAmount.description: Manual amount > a check box indicating that the amount has been entered manually.

manualAmountInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Manual amount in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

amount.description:
Amount > The amount after the discount has been applied. The value of this read-only box
is calculated automatically by deducting the discount amount from the extended price.

cost.description:
Cost > The total cost of the line in default currency. 
The value will always be 0 for unreleased documents.

amountInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Amount in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

uom.description: UoM > The unit of measure (UoM) for the item.

discountPercent.description:
Discount percent > The percent of the line-level discount that has been applied manually or
automatically.The system selects the Manual Discount check box and
calculates the discount amount after you have entered the percent manually and
saved your changes or added a new line.

discountAmount.description:
Discount amount > The amount of the line-level discount that has been applied manually or
automatically to this line.The system selects the Manual Discount check box
and calculates the line amount after you have entered the discount amount
manually and save your changes or added a new line.

discountAmountInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Discount amount in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

manualDiscount.description:
Manual discount > A check box that indicates (if selected) that the discount has been applied
manually.If you clear the check box, the system clears entered discount percent,
or discount amount, or selected discount code.

salesperson.description: The field is deprecated for customer document endpoints, please use Seller instead

deferralSchedule.description: Original deferral schedule > A read-only column filled in by the system in the Cash return documents created by the reversing process. It shows the identifier of the deferral schedule associated with the original Cash sale document.

deferralCode.description:
The deferral code assigned to the stock item or non-stock item specified in this
document line.Upon release of the document, the system generates a deferral
schedule (or schedules) based on the settings defined in this deferral code.

discountCode.description: The code of the line discount that has been applied to this line automatically or manually.

active.description: Active > The status of the identifier.

segments.description: Segments are entities that you use to define the structure of IDs for the subaccount.  This information is collected from window CS202000.

CreditNoteDto.description: This class represents a invoice in InvoiceController. Used by getting data.

hold.description: The top part > Hold > A check box that indicates (if selected) that the document is a draft. A document with the On Hold status may be edited and cannot be released.

discountTotal.description: The top part > Discount total > The document discount total.

discountTotalInCurrency.description: The top part > Discount total > The document discount total in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in a another currency than your default.

detailTotal.description: The top part > Detail total > The document total, which the system calculates for all line items in the Document details tab.

detailTotalInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Detail total in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in a another currency than your default.

vatTaxableTotal.description: The top part > VAT taxable total > The document total that is subjected to VAT.

vatTaxableTotalInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the VAT taxable total in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in a another currency than your default.

vatExemptTotal.description: The top part > VAT exempt. total > The document total that is exempt from VAT. This total is calculated as the taxable amount for the tax with the Include in VAT Exempt Total check box selected on the Taxes form.This box is available only if the VAT Reporting feature is enabled in your system.

vatExemptTotalInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the VAT exempt. total in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in a another currency than your default.

salesPersonID.description: The field is deprecated for customer document endpoints, please use SalesPerson instead

salesPersonDescr.description: The field is deprecated for customer document endpoints, please use SalesPerson instead

paymentReference.description: ///The top part > Payment ref. > The reference number of the document, as automatically generated by the system in accordance with the number series assigned to cash sales in the Customer ledger preferences window..

documentType.description: The top part > Type > The document type. The following types are available: invoice, debit note, credit note, overdue charge, credit write-off

referenceNumber.description: The Top part > Ref. no. > The reference number of the customer ledger document in the system.

postPeriod.description: The top part > Post period > The period to which the document should be posted. Format YYYYMM.

financialPeriod.description: The financial period to which the transactions recorded in the document should be posted. Format YYYYMM.

documentDate.description:
The top part > Date* > The date when the customer ledger document was created.
By default, for a new document, it is the current business date, but you can change the date.

origInvoiceDate.description:
The top part > Orig invoice date > The date based on which the Due date and Cash discount date is calculated. Only used if setting "Use Orig Invoice Date" is active in AR Preferences.
By default, for a new document, it is the current business date, but you can change the date.

status.description: The top part > Status > The status of the document, which can be one of the following: Hold, Balanced, Voided, Scheduled, Open, Closed, Pending print, Pending email.

currencyId.description: The top part > Currency > The currency of the document. By default, it is the customer???s default currency,but it can be changed if the Allow Currency Override check box is selected in the AR303000 window.

amount.description:
The top part > Amount > The amount paid by the document. The value appears for new documents if the Validate document totals on entry check box is selected on the AR101000 window.
If the check box is cleared, then the value appears when the document status is Open.

amountInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Amount in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in a another currency than your default.

balance.description:
The top part > Balance > For an open customer ledger document, the balance after any cash discount was taken. 
For a document used in the application process, this is the balance after the payments were applied.

balanceInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Balance in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in a another currency than your default.

cashDiscount.description: The top part > Cash discount > The cash discount amount that has been or will be taken on the document, which the system calculates based on the specified credit terms.

cashDiscountInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Cash discount in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

customerRefNumber.description: The top part > External reference > The external reference used in AutoInvoice.

invoiceText.description: The top part > Invoice text > Any user-provided description of the customer ledger document.

lastModifiedDateTime.description: System generated field for last modification date/time of document.

createdDateTime.description: The Attachments tab > Creation time > The date the attachment was created.

note.description: Icon Notes on top of the window > Pop-up window for providing any user-defined text connected to the document.

vatTotal.description: The top part > VAT total > The VAT amount of the document, as defined on the VAT details tab.

vatTotalInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the VAT total in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in a another currency than your default.

cashAccount.description: Financial details tab > The payment information section > Cash account > The cash account associated with the payment method.

customerProject.description: The top part > Customer project no. > The customer project no. used in AutoInvoice.

postPeriodInCreditNoteUpdateDto.description: The financial period to which the transactions recorded in the document should be posted. Use the format MMYYYY.

financialPeriodInCreditNoteUpdateDto.description: The financial period to which the transactions recorded in the document should be posted. Use the format YYYYMM.

salesPersonIDInCreditNoteUpdateDto.description: The field is deprecated for customer document endpoints, please use Salesperson instead

salespersonInCreditNoteUpdateDto.description: The identifier of the salesperson involved.

createdDateTime.description: System retrieved information for created date and time.

pageSize.description:
Pagination parameter. Number of items to be collected.
Please use a page size lower or equal to the allowed max page size which is returned as part of the metadata information.
If requested page size is greater than allowed max page size, request will be limited to max page size.

visibleTo.description: VisibleTo: AL - All, VE - Suppliers, CU - Customers, DS - Disabled

dueDateType.description:
Due Date Type , values:
N - Fixed Number of Days, 
D - Day of Next Month, 
E - End of the Month, 
M - End of Next Month, 
T - Day of the Month, 
P - Fixed Number of Days starting Next Month, 
C - Custom.

moveDueDateIfOnTheWeekend.description:
Move Due Date If On The Weekend, values:
1 - Keep the exact date, 
2 - Day before (Friday),  
3 - Day after (Monday).

discountType.description:
Discount Type , values:
N - Fixed Number of Days, 
D - Day of Next Month, 
E - End of the Month, 
M - End of Next Month, 
T - Day of the Month, 
P - Fixed Number of Days starting Next Month.

calculationType.description: Calculation Type: G - Gross amount, N - Net amount

instalmentType.description: Instalment Type: S - Simple, M - Multiple

instalmentFrequency.description:
Instalment Frequency, values:
W - Weekly,
M - Monthly,
B - Semi-monthly (the second installment comes a half a month after the first one, and so on).

instalmentMethod.description:
Instalment Method, values:
E - Equal Parts,
A - All Tax in First Installment (the total amount before tax is split equally between installments and the entire amount of tax is added to the first installment),
S - Split by Percents in Table (the days and amounts of installments are defined by the related Instalments Schedule records).

id.description: Currency Id.

description.description: Currency description.

isBaseCurrency.description: Identify if the currency is the base currency.

isUsedForAccounting.description: Identify if is used for accounting.

id.description: Currency rate Id.
Currency rate type Id.

description.description: Description.

id.description: The top part > Class ID	> The unique identifier of the class. You can use an alphanumeric string of up to 10 characters.

description.description: The top part > Description > A detailed description of the customer class.

taxZoneId.description: The General information tab > VAT zone ID >	The default VAT zone for customers of the class.

requiredTaxzoneId.description: The General information tab > Require VAT zone > A check box that means (if selected) that the VAT zone value is required for customers of the class.

paymentMethodId.description: The General information tab > Payment method > The payment method used by default in relations with these customers.

number.description: The identifier of the particular destination of the selected type.

name.description: The name of the particular destination of the selected type.

status.description: Select to filter on status on order.

greaterThanValue.description: Filter on Order no. greater than value.

numberToRead.description: This field has been deprecated and will be removed in future versions. Use pagenumber and pagesize for pagination purposes. Pagenumber and pagesize does not work with NumberToRead and SkipRecords.

skipRecords.description: This field has been deprecated and will be removed in future versions. Use pagenumber and pagesize for pagination purposes. Pagenumber and pagesize does not work with NumberToRead and SkipRecords.

orderBy.description: This field has been deprecated and will be removed in future versions. The OrderBy parameter has no effect on the result.

showNotes.description: Set to true to include notes.

lastModifiedDateTime.description: System generated value for last modification of transaction/record. Use format: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM (date and time) to filter from date to present.

pageSize.description:
Pagination parameter. Number of items to be collected.
Please use a page size lower or equal to the allowed max page size which is returned as part of the metadata information.
If requested page size is greater than allowed max page size, request will be limited to max page size.

salesPersonInSalesOrderLineDto.description: Salesperson ID > The salesperson associated with the sale of the line item.

id.description: Click on the magnifier. > The identifier.

description.description: Click on the magnifier. > The description.

subaccountInSalesOrderLineDto.description: Subaccount > A subcategory of the account that carries identifying information.

id.description: Click on the magnifier. > The identifier.

description.description: Click on the magnifier. > The description.

invoiceNbr.description: The reference number of the invoice generated for this order. This number is collected from the system and not visible on the sales order line.

operation.description: The operation to be performed in the workspace to fulfil the order. This information is collected from the system and not visible on the sales order line.

freeItem.description: A check box that indicates (if selected) that the stock item specified in the row is a free item. This information is collected from the system and not visible on the sales order line.

requestedOn.description: Mandatory field: The top part  > Requested on* > The date when the customer wants to receive the goods. The default value is the current business date.

shipOn.description: Ship on > The date when the item is to be shipped.

shipComplete.description: Shipping rule > An option that controls whether incomplete and partial shipments for the order are allowed. (Values: Ship complete, Back order allowed, Cancel remainder)

undershipThreshold.description: Undership threshold (%) > The minimal percentage of goods shipped (with respect to the ordered quantity) to consider the order shipped completely.

overshipThreshold.description: Overship threshold (%) > The maximum percentage of goods shipped (with respect to the ordered quantity) allowed by the customer.

completed.description: Completed > A check box that can be selected to indicate to the system that this line is completed.

markForPO.description: Mark for purchase order > A check box that indicates (if selected) that the order line was marked for purchasing (if it has not been shipped completely).

poSource.description: Purchase order source > The purchase order source to be used to fulfill this line, which can be one of the following options: Purchase to order, Drop-shipment.

lotSerialNbr.description: Lot/serial no. > The lot or serial number of the item for returns

expirationDate.description: Expiration date > The expiration date for the item with the specified lot number.

reasonCode.description: Reason code > The reason code to be used for creation or cancellation of the order, if applicable.

taxCategory.description: VAT code > The VAT category of the goods mentioned in this line.

commissionable.description: VAT code > The VAT category of the goods mentioned in this line.

alternateID.description: Alternate ID > The alternate ID for the item, such as the item ID used by the customer.

projectTask.description: Project task > The particular task of the project with which this document is associated.

projectTaskCd.description: Project task code > The particular task code of the project with which this document is associated.

lineNbr.description: Document details tab > Line no. > The line number of the document.

sortOrder.description: Document details tab > Line order > The order number of the document line. The system regenerates this number automatically when you reorder the lines in the table.

uom.description: Mandatory field: Document details tab > UoM* > The unit of measure (UoM) used for the item with this item ID.

quantity.description: Document details tab > Quantity > The quantity of the item sold, measured in the UoM.

qtyOnShipments.description: Document details tab > Qty. on shipments > A read-only column that displays the quantity of the stock item being prepared for shipment and already shipped for this order.

openQty.description: Document details tab > Open qty. > The quantity of the item to be shipped; that is, the total quantity minus the quantity shipped according to closed shipment documents.

unitCost.description: Document details tab > Unit Cost > The cost of the unit on the sales order.

unitPrice.description: Document details tab > Unit price > The price of the unit on the sales order.

discountCode.description: Mandatory field: Document details tab > Discount details tab > Discount code* > The code of the discount that has been applied to this line.

discountPercent.description: Document details tab > Discount percent > The percent of the line-level discount that has been applied manually or automatically to this line item (if the item is not a free item).

discountAmount.description: Document details tab > Discount amount > The amount of the line-level discount that has been applied manually or automatically to this line item (if the item is not a free item).

manualDiscount.description: Document details tab > Manual discount > A check box that indicates (if selected) that the discount has been applied manually.

discUnitPrice.description: Document details tab > Disc. unit price > The unit price, which has been recalculated after the application of discounts.

extPrice.description: Document details tab > Extended cost > The extended price, which is the unit price multiplied by the quantity.

unbilledAmount.description: Document details tab > Amount not yet invoiced > The amount of cancelled shipments and cancelled remainders.

lineDescription.description: Document details tab > Line description > The description of the unit.

note.description: Tables in tab > Icon Notes > Pop-up window for providing any user-defined text connected to the order.

attachments.description: The data containing information about the document attachments

SalesOrderDto.description: This class represents a SOOrder in SOOrderController. Used by getting data.

project.description: Mandatory field: The top part > Project* > The field consists of Project ID and Project description. Project ID: The identifier for the project with which this document is associated, or the code indicating that this document is not associated with any project; the non-project code is specified in the Project accounting preferences (PM101000) window.

projectCD.description: Mandatory field: The top part > Project* > The field consists of Project ID and Project description. Project ID: The identifier for the project with which this document is associated, or the code indicating that this document is not associated with any project; the non-project code is specified in the Project accounting preferences (PM101000) window.

printDescriptionOnInvoice.description: The top part > Print description on invoice > A check box

printNoteOnExternalDocuments.description: The top part > Print note on external sales documents > A check box

printNoteOnInternalDocuments.description: The top part > Print line note on internal sales documents > A check box

invoiceSeparately.description: Financial settings tab > Financial information section > Invoice separately > A check box that indicating that this document is to be invoiced separately (if that is required).

invoiceNbr.description: Financial settings tab > Financial information section > Invoice no.> The invoice number of the invoice generated for this order.

invoiceDate.description: Financial settings tab > Financial information section > Invoice date> The date of the invoice generated for the order.

dueDate.description: Financial settings tab > Financial information section > Due date > The due date of the invoice according to the credit terms.

cashDiscountDate.description: Financial settings tab > Financial information section > Cash discount date > The date when the cash discount is available for the invoice based on the credit terms.

postPeriod.description: The Financial settings tab > Financial information section > Post period > The period to post the transactions generated by the invoice. Format MMYYYY.

commissionPercent.description: The Commissions tab > Commission (%) > The percentage of commission generally earned by the salesperson.

commissionAmount.description: The Commissions tab > Commission amt. >	The commission amount earned by the salesperson on this document.

commissionableAmount.description: The Commissions tab > Commissionable amount	> The amount used to calculate the commission.

origOrderType.description: Mandatory field: The top part > Order type* > The type of the document, which is one of the predefined order types or a custom order type created by using the window SO201000.

origOrderNbr.description: The top part > Order no. > The order number of the document.

schedShipment.description: Delivery settings tab > Shipping information section > Sched. shipment > The date when the ordered goods are scheduled to be shipped.

shipSeparately.description: Delivery settings tab > Shipping information section > Ship separately > This check box indicates that the goods for the customer should be shipped separately for each sales order.

shipComplete.description: Delivery settings tab > Shipping information section > Shipping rule > An option that controls whether incomplete and partial shipments for the order are allowed.

cancelBy.description: Delivery settings tab > Shipping information section > Cancel by > The date when the order should be cancelled if the Back order allowed option has been selected in the Shipping rule field.

canceled.description: The Delivery settings tab > The Shipping information section > Cancelled > A check box that indicates that the order has been cancelled on the date specified in Cancel by.

priority.description: Delivery settings tab > Shipping information section > Priority > Field only for informational purposes. The level of priority for processing order of this customer, as specified for the customer on the Shipping settings tab on the AR303000 window.

residentialDelivery.description: Delivery settings tab > Shipping information section > Residential delivery > A check box that you select to indicate that the shipment should be delivered to a residential area.

saturdayDelivery.description: Delivery settings tab > Shipping information section > Saturday delivery > A check box that indicates that the order may be delivered on Saturday.

insurance.description: Delivery settings tab > Shipping information section > Insurance > A check box that you select to indicate that insurance is required for this order.

isRotRutDeductible.description: A check box indicating if the document is Rot/rut deductible (applicable for the Swedish markets)

emailed.description: A check box indicating if the document is emailed

orderType.description: Mandatory field: The top part > Order type > The type of the document, which is one of the predefined order types or a custom order type created by using the (SO201000) window.

orderNo.description: The top part > Order no.: > The reference number of the document.

status.description: The top part > Status > The status of the document, which can be one of the following options: On hold, Credit hold, Pending a????roval, Rejected, Open, Cancelled, Shipping, Back order, Invoiced, Completed.

hold.description: The top part > Hold > A check box that you select if the document is on hold and should not be processed further at this time.

date.description: Mandatory field: The top part > Date* >  The date of the document.

requestOn.description: Mandatory field: The top part > Requested on > The date when the customer wants to receive the goods; this date provides the default values for the Requested on dates for order lines.

customerOrder.description: The top part > Customer order > The reference number of the original customer document that the sales order is based on.

customerRefNo.description: The top part > External reference > The reference number of the sales order in a third-party application if Visma.net Financials is integrated with such an application and imports the sales orders from it.

contactId.description: The top part > Contact > The contact person of the customer.

currency.description: The top part > Currency > The currency of the document.

description.description: The top part > Description > A brief description of the document.

orderTotal.description:
The top part > Order total > The total amount of the document, which is calculated as follows:
Line Total + Misc.Charges + Freight + Premium Freight ??? Discount Total+ Tax Total

vatTaxableTotal.description: The top part > VAT taxable total > The document total that is subject to VAT.

vatExemptTotal.description: The top part > VAT exempt total > The document total that is exempt from VAT.

taxTotal.description: The top part > VAT total > The total amount of tax paid on the document.

lastModifiedDateTime.description: Background information collected from the system.

note.description: Icon Notes on top of the window > Pop-up window for providing any user-defined text connected to the order.

attachments.description: The data containing information about the document attachments

SalesOrderDocumentLineDto.description: This class represents a SOOrder in SOOrderController. Used by getting data.

lineNbr.description: Document details tab > Line no. > The line number of the document.

sortOrder.description: Document details tab > Line order > The order number of the document line. The system regenerates this number automatically when you reorder the lines in the table.

uom.description: Mandatory field: Document details tab > UoM* > The unit of measure (UoM) used for the item with this item ID.

quantity.description: Document details tab > Quantity > The quantity of the item sold, measured in the UoM.

qtyOnShipments.description: Document details tab > Qty. on shipments > A read-only column that displays the quantity of the stock item being prepared for shipment and already shipped for this order.

openQty.description: Document details tab > Open qty. > The quantity of the item to be shipped; that is, the total quantity minus the quantity shipped according to closed shipment documents.

unitCost.description: Document details tab > Unit Cost > The cost of the unit on the sales order.

unitPrice.description: Document details tab > Unit price > The price of the unit on the sales order.

discountCode.description: Mandatory field: Document details tab > Discount details tab > Discount code* > The code of the discount that has been applied to this line.

discountPercent.description: Document details tab > Discount percent > The percent of the line-level discount that has been applied manually or automatically to this line item (if the item is not a free item).

discountAmount.description: Document details tab > Discount amount > The amount of the line-level discount that has been applied manually or automatically to this line item (if the item is not a free item).

manualDiscount.description: Document details tab > Manual discount > A check box that indicates (if selected) that the discount has been applied manually.

orderType.description: Mandatory field: The top part > Order type > The type of the document, which is one of the predefined order types or a custom order type created by using the (SO201000) window.

orderNo.description: The top part > Order no.: > The reference number of the document.

status.description: The top part > Status > The status of the document, which can be one of the following options: On hold, Credit hold, Pending a????roval, Rejected, Open, Cancelled, Shipping, Back order, Invoiced, Completed.

hold.description: The top part > Hold > A check box that you select if the document is on hold and should not be processed further at this time.

date.description: Mandatory field: The top part > Date* >  The date of the document.

requestOn.description: Mandatory field: The top part > Requested on > The date when the customer wants to receive the goods; this date provides the default values for the Requested on dates for order lines.

customerOrder.description: The top part > Customer order > The reference number of the original customer document that the sales order is based on.

customerRefNo.description: The top part > External reference > The reference number of the sales order in a third-party application if Visma.net Financials is integrated with such an application and imports the sales orders from it.

contactId.description: The top part > Contact > The contact person of the customer.

currency.description: The top part > Currency > The currency of the document.

description.description: The top part > Description > A brief description of the document.

orderTotal.description:
The top part > Order total > The total amount of the document, which is calculated as follows:
Line Total + Misc.Charges + Freight + Premium Freight ??? Discount Total+ Tax Total

vatTaxableTotal.description: The top part > VAT taxable total > The document total that is subject to VAT.

vatExemptTotal.description: The top part > VAT exempt total > The document total that is exempt from VAT.

taxTotal.description: The top part > VAT total > The total amount of tax paid on the document.

CustomerDto.description: This class represents a customer in CustomerController. Used by getting data.

number.description: Mandatory field: The top part > Customer ID* > The ID of the customer account, which is defined by the BIZACCT segmented key or by the CUSTOMER segmented key. When you are creating a new customer, you must specify an ID.

name.description: Mandatory field: The top part > Customer name* > The name of the customer to appear in the system, which may be a trade name or a doing-business-as (DBA) name.

status.description: Mandatory field: The top part > Status* > The status of the customer account. You can select one of the following options: Active, On hold, Credit hold, Inactive, One time.

accountReference.description: General information tab > Main contact section > Account ref. > Your company's account number in the customer's system.

currencyId.description: The General information tab > Financial settings section > Currency ID > The currency used in operations with the customer, which you can select from the list of currencies defined in the system.

creditVerification.description: The General information tab > Credit verification rules > Credit verification > The credit rule applied to this customer. The following options are available: Days past due, Credit limit, Limit and days past due, disabled.

creditLimit.description: The General information tab > Credit verification rules section > Credit limit > The amount, if applicable, that serves as a credit limit for the customer.

creditDaysPastDue.description: General information tab > Credit verification rules section > Credit days past due > The maximum number of days by which the customer payment may exceed the invoice date.

printInvoices.description: Invoicing settings > Print and email settings section > Print invoices > A check box that, if selected, indicates that invoices can be printed in the Print invoice (AR508000) window.

acceptAutoInvoices.description: Invoicing settings > Print and email settings section > Send invoices to AutoInvoice > Select this check box if you are using AutoInvoice and want to send invoices directly to this service.

sendInvoicesByEmail.description: Invoicing settings > Print and email settings section > Send invoices by email > A check box that, if selected, indicates that you can send invoices by email by using the Print invoices (AR508000) window.

printStatements.description: Invoicing settings > Print and email settings section > Print statements > A check box that, if selected, indicates that statements can be printed in the Print statements (AR503500) window.

sendStatementsByEmail.description: Invoicing settings > Print and email settings section > Send statement by email > A check box that, if selected, indicates that statements can be sent by email to customers of the class in the Print statements  (AR503500) window.

printMultiCurrencyStatements.description: Invoicing settings > Print and email settings section > Multi-currency statements > A check box that indicates (if selected) that this customer's statements must be printed in multi-currency format.

statementType.description: Invoicing settings > Print and email settings section > Statement type > The statement type used by default in relations with the customer, which can be one of the following: Open item, Balance brought forward.

vatRegistrationId.description: Deliver settings tab > Default location settings section > VAT registration ID > The customer's taxpayer ID associated with the location.

corporateId.description: Delivery settings tab > Default location settings section > Corporate ID > The customers company ID, associated with the location.

gln.description: Delivery settings tab > Default location settings section > GLN > The Global Location Number, associated with the location.

attributes.description: Information collected from the system. Not visible on the screen.

defaultPaymentMethodId.description: Invoicing settings tab > Default payment method section > The default payment method.

directDebitLines.description: Update direct debit information for a customer(only for Netherlands)

greaterThanValue.description: This field does not work and has been deprecated. It will be removed in future versions.

numberToRead.description:
[This field has been deprecated and will be removed in future versions. Use pagenumber and pagesize for pagination purposes. Pagenumber and pagesize does not work with NumberToRead and SkipRecords.]
Tells the service to return only {numberToRead} number of records.

skipRecords.description:
[This field has been deprecated and will be removed in future versions. Use pagenumber and pagesize for pagination purposes. Pagenumber and pagesize does not work with NumberToRead and SkipRecords.]
Tells the service to return only records after the first {skipRecords} number of records.

termStartDate.description:
Term start date > The date when the process of deferred revenue recognition should start for the selected item; this date can be specified manually if the deferral code assigned to the item is based on the Flexible by periods, prorate by days or Flexible by days in period recognition method.
This column only appears if the Deferred revenue management functionality is enabled in the(CS100000) window.

termEndDate.description:
Term end date > The date when the process of the deferred revenue recognition should finish for the selected item; this date can be specified manually if the deferral code assigned to the item is based on the Flexible by periods, prorate by days or Flexible by days in period recognition method.
This column only appears if the Deferred revenue management functionality is enabled in the(CS100000) window.

lineNumber.description: Line no. > A counter of lines in the overview of cash sales document overview.

inventoryNumber.description: Item ID > The item ID of the line item, if applicable. Only a non-stock item can be selected.

description.description: Transaction descr. > Any brief comment relevant to the transaction.The alphanumeric string may contain up to 30 characters.

quantity.description: Quantity > The quantity of items (goods or services) of a particular type sold to the customer.

unitPrice.description:
Unit price > The unit price set for the item or service. If you want to update the unit price
automatically to the current value(that is, the applicable sales or default price),
you can use the Recalculate Prices and Discounts action.If you have modified
the unit price and saved the document, the value will not be updated by the
system if you change the document date.

unitPriceInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Unit price in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

manualAmount.description: Manual amount > a check box indicating that the amount has been entered manually.

manualAmountInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Manual amount in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

amount.description:
Amount > The amount after the discount has been applied. The value of this read-only box
is calculated automatically by deducting the discount amount from the extended price.

cost.description:
Cost > The total cost of the line in default currency. 
The value will always be 0 for unreleased documents.

amountInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Amount in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

uom.description: UoM > The unit of measure (UoM) for the item.

discountPercent.description:
Discount percent > The percent of the line-level discount that has been applied manually or
automatically.The system selects the Manual Discount check box and
calculates the discount amount after you have entered the percent manually and
saved your changes or added a new line.

discountAmount.description:
Discount amount > The amount of the line-level discount that has been applied manually or
automatically to this line.The system selects the Manual Discount check box
and calculates the line amount after you have entered the discount amount
manually and save your changes or added a new line.

discountAmountInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Discount amount in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

manualDiscount.description:
Manual discount > A check box that indicates (if selected) that the discount has been applied
manually.If you clear the check box, the system clears entered discount percent,
or discount amount, or selected discount code.

salesperson.description: The field is deprecated for customer document endpoints, please use Seller instead

deferralSchedule.description: Original deferral schedule > A read-only column filled in by the system in the Cash return documents created by the reversing process. It shows the identifier of the deferral schedule associated with the original Cash sale document.

deferralCode.description:
The deferral code assigned to the stock item or non-stock item specified in this
document line.Upon release of the document, the system generates a deferral
schedule (or schedules) based on the settings defined in this deferral code.

discountCode.description: The code of the line discount that has been applied to this line automatically or manually.

CustomerInvoiceDto.description: This class represents an invoice in InvoiceController. Used by getting data.

documentDueDate.description: Mandatory field: The top part > Due date* > The date when payment for the document is due, in accordance with the credit terms.

cashDiscountDate.description: Mandatory field: The top part > Cash discount date * > The end date of the cash discount period, which the system calculates by using the credit terms.

externalReference.description: The top part > External reference > The external reference used in AutoInvoice.

isRotRutDeductible.description: The top part > Domestic services deductible document > A check box indicating if the document is Rot/rut deductible (applicable for the Swedish markets)

dunningLetterDate.description: The Financial details tab > The dunning info section > Dunning letter date > The date of the last released dunning letter in which the document was listed.

dunningLetterLevel.description: The Financial details tab > The dunning info section > Dunning level > The dunning level of the document.

sendToAutoInvoice.description: The Attachment tab > Send the file to AutoInvoice > The selected files will be attached to the invoice.

roundingDiff.description: The top part > Rounding diff. > The difference between the original amount and the rounded amount.

hold.description: The top part > Hold > A check box that indicates (if selected) that the document is a draft. A document with the On Hold status may be edited and cannot be released.

discountTotal.description: The top part > Discount total > The document discount total.

discountTotalInCurrency.description: The top part > Discount total > The document discount total in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in a another currency than your default.

detailTotal.description: The top part > Detail total > The document total, which the system calculates for all line items in the Document details tab.

detailTotalInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Detail total in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in a another currency than your default.

vatTaxableTotal.description: The top part > VAT taxable total > The document total that is subjected to VAT.

vatTaxableTotalInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the VAT taxable total in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in a another currency than your default.

vatExemptTotal.description: The top part > VAT exempt. total > The document total that is exempt from VAT. This total is calculated as the taxable amount for the tax with the Include in VAT Exempt Total check box selected on the Taxes form.This box is available only if the VAT Reporting feature is enabled in your system.

vatExemptTotalInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the VAT exempt. total in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in a another currency than your default.

salesPersonID.description: The field is deprecated for customer document endpoints, please use SalesPerson instead

salesPersonDescr.description: The field is deprecated for customer document endpoints, please use SalesPerson instead

paymentReference.description: ///The top part > Payment ref. > The reference number of the document, as automatically generated by the system in accordance with the number series assigned to cash sales in the Customer ledger preferences window..

documentType.description: The top part > Type > The document type. The following types are available: invoice, debit note, credit note, overdue charge, credit write-off

referenceNumber.description: The Top part > Ref. no. > The reference number of the customer ledger document in the system.

postPeriod.description: The top part > Post period > The period to which the document should be posted. Format YYYYMM.

financialPeriod.description: The financial period to which the transactions recorded in the document should be posted. Format YYYYMM.

documentDate.description:
The top part > Date* > The date when the customer ledger document was created.
By default, for a new document, it is the current business date, but you can change the date.

origInvoiceDate.description:
The top part > Orig invoice date > The date based on which the Due date and Cash discount date is calculated. Only used if setting "Use Orig Invoice Date" is active in AR Preferences.
By default, for a new document, it is the current business date, but you can change the date.

status.description: The top part > Status > The status of the document, which can be one of the following: Hold, Balanced, Voided, Scheduled, Open, Closed, Pending print, Pending email.

currencyId.description: The top part > Currency > The currency of the document. By default, it is the customer???s default currency,but it can be changed if the Allow Currency Override check box is selected in the AR303000 window.

amount.description:
The top part > Amount > The amount paid by the document. The value appears for new documents if the Validate document totals on entry check box is selected on the AR101000 window.
If the check box is cleared, then the value appears when the document status is Open.

amountInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Amount in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in a another currency than your default.

balance.description:
The top part > Balance > For an open customer ledger document, the balance after any cash discount was taken. 
For a document used in the application process, this is the balance after the payments were applied.

balanceInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Balance in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in a another currency than your default.

cashDiscount.description: The top part > Cash discount > The cash discount amount that has been or will be taken on the document, which the system calculates based on the specified credit terms.

cashDiscountInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Cash discount in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

customerRefNumber.description: The top part > External reference > The external reference used in AutoInvoice.

invoiceText.description: The top part > Invoice text > Any user-provided description of the customer ledger document.

lastModifiedDateTime.description: System generated field for last modification date/time of document.

createdDateTime.description: The Attachments tab > Creation time > The date the attachment was created.

note.description: Icon Notes on top of the window > Pop-up window for providing any user-defined text connected to the document.

vatTotal.description: The top part > VAT total > The VAT amount of the document, as defined on the VAT details tab.

vatTotalInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the VAT total in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in a another currency than your default.

cashAccount.description: Financial details tab > The payment information section > Cash account > The cash account associated with the payment method.

customerProject.description: The top part > Customer project no. > The customer project no. used in AutoInvoice.

active.description: Active > The status of the identifier.

segments.description: Segments are entities that you use to define the structure of IDs for the subaccount.  This information is collected from window CS202000.

documentType.description: The top part > Type > The document type. The following types are available: invoice, debit note, credit note, overdue charge, credit write-off

referenceNumber.description: The Top part > Ref. no. > The reference number of the customer ledger document in the system.

postPeriod.description: The top part > Post period > The period to which the document should be posted. Format YYYYMM.

financialPeriod.description: The financial period to which the transactions recorded in the document should be posted. Format YYYYMM.

documentDate.description:
The top part > Date* > The date when the customer ledger document was created.
By default, for a new document, it is the current business date, but you can change the date.

origInvoiceDate.description:
The top part > Orig invoice date > The date based on which the Due date and Cash discount date is calculated. Only used if setting "Use Orig Invoice Date" is active in AR Preferences.
By default, for a new document, it is the current business date, but you can change the date.

status.description: The top part > Status > The status of the document, which can be one of the following: Hold, Balanced, Voided, Scheduled, Open, Closed, Pending print, Pending email.

currencyId.description: The top part > Currency > The currency of the document. By default, it is the customer???s default currency,but it can be changed if the Allow Currency Override check box is selected in the AR303000 window.

amount.description:
The top part > Amount > The amount paid by the document. The value appears for new documents if the Validate document totals on entry check box is selected on the AR101000 window.
If the check box is cleared, then the value appears when the document status is Open.

amountInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Amount in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in a another currency than your default.

balance.description:
The top part > Balance > For an open customer ledger document, the balance after any cash discount was taken. 
For a document used in the application process, this is the balance after the payments were applied.

balanceInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Balance in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in a another currency than your default.

cashDiscount.description: The top part > Cash discount > The cash discount amount that has been or will be taken on the document, which the system calculates based on the specified credit terms.

cashDiscountInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Cash discount in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

customerRefNumber.description: The top part > External reference > The external reference used in AutoInvoice.

invoiceText.description: The top part > Invoice text > Any user-provided description of the customer ledger document.

lastModifiedDateTime.description: System generated field for last modification date/time of document.

createdDateTime.description: The Attachments tab > Creation time > The date the attachment was created.

note.description: Icon Notes on top of the window > Pop-up window for providing any user-defined text connected to the document.

vatTotal.description: The top part > VAT total > The VAT amount of the document, as defined on the VAT details tab.

vatTotalInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the VAT total in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in a another currency than your default.

cashAccount.description: Financial details tab > The payment information section > Cash account > The cash account associated with the payment method.

customerProject.description: The top part > Customer project no. > The customer project no. used in AutoInvoice.

setupDate.description: Mandatory field: Contract settings section > Setup date* > The date of contract setup.

renewalPoint.description: Contract settings section > Renewal point > The number of days before expiration where the renewal process are to begin.

nextInvoicingDate.description: Invoicing schedule section > Next invoicing date > The date of the next invoicing invoice, according to the invoicing schedule.

invoiceTo.description: Invoice information section > Invoice to > The setting that defines the customer account to be invoiced for a contract. The following options are available: Parent account, Customer account, Specific account.

termStartDate.description:
The date when the process of deferred revenue recognition should start for the
selected item; this date can be specified manually if the deferral code assigned
to the item is based on the Flexible by Periods, Prorate by days or Flexible by
Days in Period recognition method.This column appears only if the Deferred
Revenue Management feature is enabled on the Enable/Disable Features screen.

termEndDate.description:
The date when the process of the deferred revenue recognition should finish
for the selected item; this date can be specified manually if the deferral code
assigned to the item is based on the Flexible by Periods, Prorate by days or
Flexible by Days in Period recognition method.This column appears only if the
Deferred Revenue Management feature is enabled on the Enable/Disable Features form.

lineNumber.description: Line no. > A counter of lines in the overview of cash sales document overview.

inventoryNumber.description: Item ID > The item ID of the line item, if applicable. Only a non-stock item can be selected.

description.description: Transaction descr. > Any brief comment relevant to the transaction.The alphanumeric string may contain up to 30 characters.

quantity.description: Quantity > The quantity of items (goods or services) of a particular type sold to the customer.

unitPrice.description:
Unit price > The unit price set for the item or service. If you want to update the unit price
automatically to the current value(that is, the applicable sales or default price),
you can use the Recalculate Prices and Discounts action.If you have modified
the unit price and saved the document, the value will not be updated by the
system if you change the document date.

unitPriceInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Unit price in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

manualAmount.description: Manual amount > a check box indicating that the amount has been entered manually.

manualAmountInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Manual amount in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

amount.description:
Amount > The amount after the discount has been applied. The value of this read-only box
is calculated automatically by deducting the discount amount from the extended price.

cost.description:
Cost > The total cost of the line in default currency. 
The value will always be 0 for unreleased documents.

amountInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Amount in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

uom.description: UoM > The unit of measure (UoM) for the item.

discountPercent.description:
Discount percent > The percent of the line-level discount that has been applied manually or
automatically.The system selects the Manual Discount check box and
calculates the discount amount after you have entered the percent manually and
saved your changes or added a new line.

discountAmount.description:
Discount amount > The amount of the line-level discount that has been applied manually or
automatically to this line.The system selects the Manual Discount check box
and calculates the line amount after you have entered the discount amount
manually and save your changes or added a new line.

discountAmountInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Discount amount in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

manualDiscount.description:
Manual discount > A check box that indicates (if selected) that the discount has been applied
manually.If you clear the check box, the system clears entered discount percent,
or discount amount, or selected discount code.

salesperson.description: The field is deprecated for customer document endpoints, please use Seller instead

deferralSchedule.description: Original deferral schedule > A read-only column filled in by the system in the Cash return documents created by the reversing process. It shows the identifier of the deferral schedule associated with the original Cash sale document.

deferralCode.description:
The deferral code assigned to the stock item or non-stock item specified in this
document line.Upon release of the document, the system generates a deferral
schedule (or schedules) based on the settings defined in this deferral code.

discountCode.description: The code of the line discount that has been applied to this line automatically or manually.
