financialPeriod.description: The financial period to which the transactions recorded in the document should be posted. Format YYYYMM.

documentDate.description:
The top part > Date* > The date when the customer ledger document was created.
By default, for a new document, it is the current business date, but you can change the date.

origInvoiceDate.description:
The top part > Orig invoice date > The date based on which the Due date and Cash discount date is calculated. Only used if setting "Use Orig Invoice Date" is active in AR Preferences.
By default, for a new document, it is the current business date, but you can change the date.

status.description: The top part > Status > The status of the document, which can be one of the following: Hold, Balanced, Voided, Scheduled, Open, Closed, Pending print, Pending email.

currencyId.description: The top part > Currency > The currency of the document. By default, it is the customer???s default currency,but it can be changed if the Allow Currency Override check box is selected in the AR303000 window.

amount.description:
The top part > Amount > The amount paid by the document. The value appears for new documents if the Validate document totals on entry check box is selected on the AR101000 window.
If the check box is cleared, then the value appears when the document status is Open.

amountInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Amount in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in a another currency than your default.

balance.description:
The top part > Balance > For an open customer ledger document, the balance after any cash discount was taken. 
For a document used in the application process, this is the balance after the payments were applied.

balanceInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Balance in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in a another currency than your default.

cashDiscount.description: The top part > Cash discount > The cash discount amount that has been or will be taken on the document, which the system calculates based on the specified credit terms.

cashDiscountInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Cash discount in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

customerRefNumber.description: The top part > External reference > The external reference used in AutoInvoice.

invoiceText.description: The top part > Invoice text > Any user-provided description of the customer ledger document.

lastModifiedDateTime.description: System generated field for last modification date/time of document.

createdDateTime.description: The Attachments tab > Creation time > The date the attachment was created.

note.description: Icon Notes on top of the window > Pop-up window for providing any user-defined text connected to the document.

vatTotal.description: The top part > VAT total > The VAT amount of the document, as defined on the VAT details tab.

vatTotalInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the VAT total in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in a another currency than your default.

cashAccount.description: Financial details tab > The payment information section > Cash account > The cash account associated with the payment method.

customerProject.description: The top part > Customer project no. > The customer project no. used in AutoInvoice.

accountInCustomerDebitNoteLineDto.description: Mandatory field: Account* > The sales account used for the transaction.

externalCode1.description: Account class > The identifier of the account class.

externalCode2.description: Account class > The name of the account class.

vatCodeInCustomerDebitNoteLineDto.description: VAT category > The VAT category (if applied) for the transaction. The category represents the type of goods or services.

description.description: Click on the magnifier. > The description.

active.description: Active > The status of the identifier.

id.description: Click on the magnifier. > The identifier.

description.description: Click on the magnifier. > The description.

branchNumberInCustomerDebitNoteLineDto.description: Mandatory field: Branch* > The branch that sells the line item or provides the service.

name.description: Click the magnifier. > The name.

termStartDate.description:
The date when the process of deferred revenue recognition should start for the
selected item; this date can be specified manually if the deferral code assigned
to the item is based on the Flexible by Periods, Prorate by days or Flexible by
Days in Period recognition method.This column appears only if the Deferred
Revenue Management feature is enabled on the Enable/Disable Features screen.

termEndDate.description:
The date when the process of the deferred revenue recognition should finish
for the selected item; this date can be specified manually if the deferral code
assigned to the item is based on the Flexible by Periods, Prorate by days or
Flexible by Days in Period recognition method.This column appears only if the
Deferred Revenue Management feature is enabled on the Enable/Disable Features form.

isRotRutDeductible.description: Domestic services deductible document > A check box indicating if the document is Rot/rut deductible (applicable for the Swedish markets)

lineNumber.description: Line no. > A counter of lines in the overview of cash sales document overview.

inventoryNumber.description: Item ID > The item ID of the line item, if applicable. Only a non-stock item can be selected.

description.description: Transaction descr. > Any brief comment relevant to the transaction.The alphanumeric string may contain up to 30 characters.

quantity.description: Quantity > The quantity of items (goods or services) of a particular type sold to the customer.

unitPrice.description:
Unit price > The unit price set for the item or service. If you want to update the unit price
automatically to the current value(that is, the applicable sales or default price),
you can use the Recalculate Prices and Discounts action.If you have modified
the unit price and saved the document, the value will not be updated by the
system if you change the document date.

unitPriceInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Unit price in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

manualAmount.description: Manual amount > a check box indicating that the amount has been entered manually.

manualAmountInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Manual amount in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

amount.description:
Amount > The amount after the discount has been applied. The value of this read-only box
is calculated automatically by deducting the discount amount from the extended price.

cost.description:
Cost > The total cost of the line in default currency. 
The value will always be 0 for unreleased documents.

amountInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Amount in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

uom.description: UoM > The unit of measure (UoM) for the item.

discountPercent.description:
Discount percent > The percent of the line-level discount that has been applied manually or
automatically.The system selects the Manual Discount check box and
calculates the discount amount after you have entered the percent manually and
saved your changes or added a new line.

discountAmount.description:
Discount amount > The amount of the line-level discount that has been applied manually or
automatically to this line.The system selects the Manual Discount check box
and calculates the line amount after you have entered the discount amount
manually and save your changes or added a new line.

discountAmountInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Discount amount in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

manualDiscount.description:
Manual discount > A check box that indicates (if selected) that the discount has been applied
manually.If you clear the check box, the system clears entered discount percent,
or discount amount, or selected discount code.

salesperson.description: The field is deprecated for customer document endpoints, please use Seller instead

deferralSchedule.description: Original deferral schedule > A read-only column filled in by the system in the Cash return documents created by the reversing process. It shows the identifier of the deferral schedule associated with the original Cash sale document.

deferralCode.description:
The deferral code assigned to the stock item or non-stock item specified in this
document line.Upon release of the document, the system generates a deferral
schedule (or schedules) based on the settings defined in this deferral code.

discountCode.description: The code of the line discount that has been applied to this line automatically or manually.

vatExemptTotal.description: The top part > VAT exempt. total > The document total that is exempt from VAT. This total is calculated as the taxable amount for the tax with the Include in VAT Exempt Total check box selected on the Taxes form.This box is available only if the VAT Reporting feature is enabled in your system.

vatExemptTotalInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the VAT exempt. total in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in a another currency than your default.

salesPersonID.description: The field is deprecated for customer document endpoints, please use SalesPerson instead

salesPersonDescr.description: The field is deprecated for customer document endpoints, please use SalesPerson instead

paymentReference.description: ///The top part > Payment ref. > The reference number of the document, as automatically generated by the system in accordance with the number series assigned to cash sales in the Customer ledger preferences window..

documentType.description: The top part > Type > The document type. The following types are available: invoice, debit note, credit note, overdue charge, credit write-off

referenceNumber.description: The Top part > Ref. no. > The reference number of the customer ledger document in the system.

postPeriod.description: The top part > Post period > The period to which the document should be posted. Format YYYYMM.

financialPeriod.description: The financial period to which the transactions recorded in the document should be posted. Format YYYYMM.

documentDate.description:
The top part > Date* > The date when the customer ledger document was created.
By default, for a new document, it is the current business date, but you can change the date.

origInvoiceDate.description:
The top part > Orig invoice date > The date based on which the Due date and Cash discount date is calculated. Only used if setting "Use Orig Invoice Date" is active in AR Preferences.
By default, for a new document, it is the current business date, but you can change the date.

status.description: The top part > Status > The status of the document, which can be one of the following: Hold, Balanced, Voided, Scheduled, Open, Closed, Pending print, Pending email.

currencyId.description: The top part > Currency > The currency of the document. By default, it is the customer???s default currency,but it can be changed if the Allow Currency Override check box is selected in the AR303000 window.

amount.description:
The top part > Amount > The amount paid by the document. The value appears for new documents if the Validate document totals on entry check box is selected on the AR101000 window.
If the check box is cleared, then the value appears when the document status is Open.

amountInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Amount in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in a another currency than your default.

balance.description:
The top part > Balance > For an open customer ledger document, the balance after any cash discount was taken. 
For a document used in the application process, this is the balance after the payments were applied.

balanceInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Balance in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in a another currency than your default.

cashDiscount.description: The top part > Cash discount > The cash discount amount that has been or will be taken on the document, which the system calculates based on the specified credit terms.

cashDiscountInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Cash discount in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

customerRefNumber.description: The top part > External reference > The external reference used in AutoInvoice.

invoiceText.description: The top part > Invoice text > Any user-provided description of the customer ledger document.

lastModifiedDateTime.description: System generated field for last modification date/time of document.

createdDateTime.description: The Attachments tab > Creation time > The date the attachment was created.

note.description: Icon Notes on top of the window > Pop-up window for providing any user-defined text connected to the document.

vatTotal.description: The top part > VAT total > The VAT amount of the document, as defined on the VAT details tab.

vatTotalInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the VAT total in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in a another currency than your default.

type.description: The top part > Type > The type of a document. The following types are available: Payment, CreditNote, Prepayment, Customer refund, Void payment, Balance write-off

status.description: The top part > Status > The status of the customer payment, which for a new document is either Balanced or On hold. [On hold, Balanced, Voided, Scheduled, Open, Closed, Pending print, Pending email, Credit hold, CcHold, Reserved]

hold.description: The top part > Hold >  A check box that indicates (if selected) that the document is a draft with the On hold status. This check box is unavailable for debit adjustments.

applicationDate.description: Mandatory field: The top part > Date* > The date when a payment is applied to a document (invoice or note). The field display the current business date for tunapplied or partially applied payments and the latest application date for the closed payment

applicationPeriod.description: Mandatory field: The top part > Financial period* > The period to which the payment should be applied, which the system fills in based on the date.

breakAmount.description: Discount breakpoints tab > Break amount > The line amount (break point) that starts the new range for the currently effective series.

lastBreakAmount.description: Discount breakpoints tab > Last break amount > The amount (break point) that started the new range for the previously effective series (the one that was used before the effective date).

pendingBreakAmount.description: Discount breakpoints tab > Pending break amount > The amount (break point) that starts the new range for the pending series (one that is not yet in effect).

breakQuantity.description: Discount breakpoints tab > Break quantity > The quantity of items (break quantity) that starts the new range for a discount level for the currently effective series. Any break quantity should be specified in the base units.

lastBreakQuantity.description: Discount breakpoints tab > Last break quantity > The quantity of item (break point) that started the range for the discount series used before the effective date.

pendingBreakQuantity.description: Discount breakpoints tab > Pending break quantity > The quantity of items (break point) that starts the new range for the pending (not yet effective) series.

discountAmount.description: Discount breakpoints tab > Discount amount > The discount amount to be used for the quantities that exceed this break quantity if the Amount option is selected as Discount by.

discountPercent.description: Discount breakpoints tab > Discount percent > The discount percent to be currently used for the quantities that exceed this break quantity if the Percent option is selected as Discount by.

lastDiscountAmount.description: Discount breakpoints tab > Last discount amount > The amount used as the discount for the discount series that was in effect before the effective date.

lastDiscountPercent.description: Discount breakpoints tab > Last discount percent > The percentage used for the break point in the previously effective series.

lastDiscount.description: Discount breakpoints tab > Last discount amount > The amount used as the discount for the discount series that was in effect before the effective date.

pendingDiscountAmount.description: Discount breakpoints tab > Pending discount amount > The amount to be used as the discount for the pending series if the Amount option is selected as Discount by.

pendingDiscountPercent.description: Discount breakpoints tab > Pending discount percent > The discount percent to be used for the break point in the pending series.

freeItemQty.description: Discount breakpoints tab > Free item qty. > The quantity of the free item to be added as the discount to orders for this discount series.

lastFreeItemQty.description: Discount breakpoints tab > Last free item qty. > The quantity of the free item that was used as the discount for the previously effective series.

pendingFreeItemQty.description: Discount breakpoints tab > Pending free item qty. > The quantity of the free item to be added as the discount to orders for the pending discount series.

discountCode.description: Mandatory field: The top part > Discount code > The code of the discount for which you want to create a new series or view an existing one.

series.description: Mandatory field: The top part > Series > The ID of the series defined for the discount.

description.description: The top part > Description > A brief description of the series.

active.description: The top part > Active > A check box that indicates (if selected) that the series is active.

prorateDiscount.description: The top part > Prorate discount > A check box that indicates (if selected) that the discount can be prorated.

applicableTo.description:
Mandatory field: Discount codes table > Applicable to > The entity to which the discount may be applied.
Applicable To values: 
CU - Customer,
CI - Customer and Item,
CP - Customer and Item Price Class,
CE - Customer Price Class,
PI - Customer Price Class and Item,
PP - Customer Price Class and Item Price Class,
CB - Customer and Branch,
PB - Customer Price Class and Branch,
WH - Warehouse,
WI - Warehouse and Item,
WC - Warehouse and Customer,
WP - Warehouse and Item Price Class,
WE - Warehouse and Customer Price Class,
BR - Branch,
IN - Item,
IE - Item Price Class,
UN - Unconditional

applyToDeferredRevenue.description: Discount codes table > Apply to deferred revenue > A check box that (if selected) indicates that a discount should be applied to a component price while computing a deferred revenue for the component.

manual.description: Discount codes table > Manual > A check box that (if selected) indicates that this discount is excluded from automatic searches for the best available discount.

closedInCustomerLedger.description: The table > Closed in Customer ledger > A read-only check box that indicates (if selected) that the financial period is closed in the Customer ledger workspace; if this check box is cleared, the period is active in this workspace.

closedInInventoryManagement.description: The table > Closed in Inventory management > Inventory management	A read-only check box that indicates (if selected) that the financial period is closed in the Inventory workspace; if this check box is cleared, the period is active in the workspace.

closedInGeneralLedger.description: The table > Closed in General ledger > A read-only check box that indicates (if selected) that the financial period is closed in the General ledger workspace; if this check box is cleared, the period is active in the this workspace.

closedInCashManagement.description: The table > Closed in Cash management > A read-only check box that indicates (if selected) that the financial period is closed in the Cash management; if this check box is cleared, the period is active in this workspace.

closedInFixedAssets.description: The table > Closed in Fixed assets > A read-only check box that indicates (if selected) that the financial period is closed in the Fixed assets workspace; if this check box is cleared, the period is active in the this workspace.

Format: 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss'

lastModifiedDateTimeCondition.description: Value to be used for filtering lastModifiedDateTime value.

expandAccountInfo.description:
By default, if no value is provided, False and the account information will include only Number, Description, Type and GlConsolAccountCD.
If True, each transaction returned will include extended information about account.

expandBranchInfo.description:
By default, if no value is provided, False and branch information will include only branch number.
If True, each transaction returned will include extended information about Branch (number and name).

includeTransactionBalance.description:
By default, if no value is provided, False and the transactions returned will not include their balances (fields BegBalance, EndingBalance, CurrBegBalance, CurrEndingBalance)
If True, each transaction returned will include its balance.

InventoryAdjustmentDto.description: This class represents a inventory issue in InventoryIssueController. Used by getting data.

totalCost.description: The top part > Total cost > The total cost of the inventory items received. The system automatically calculates this value as a sum of all extended cost values of all received inventory items listed in the??Transaction Details??tab of this form.

controlCost.description: The top part > Control cost > The manually entered cost of stock items listed in the adjustment.??Control cost??is available only if the??Validate document totals on Entry??option is selected on the??Inventory preferences??window. The user enters this value manually to confirm the total cost as calculated automatically for the document. If the??Control Cost??and??Total Cost??values do not match, the system generates a warning message and the document cannot be saved.

adjusmentLines.description: Transaction details tab > The inventory adjusment lines

referenceNumber.description: The unique reference number of the receipt, which the system automatically assigns according to the numbering sequence selected for receipts on the??Inventory Preferences??IN.10.10.00) form.

status.description:
The current status of the receipt. The following options are available: 
On Hold:The receipt/issue is a draft and can be edited. Receipts with this status cannot be released.
Balanced: The receipt/issue data has been validated by the system and the receipt can be released. It also can be modified or deleted, but changes can be saved only if the receipt is balanced.
Released: The receipt/issue has been released and cannot be edited or deleted.

hold.description: A check box that you select to give the receipt the??On Hold??status. Clear the check box to save the receipt with the??Balanced??status.

date.description: The date when the receipt was created. All transactions included in this document will have this transaction date.

postPeriod.description: The financial period to which the transactions recorded in the document should be posted. Format MMYYYY.

externalReference.description: The external reference number of the inventory issue document (for example, the vendor???s reference code).

description.description: A brief description of the inventory issue or its transactions.

totalQuantity.description: The total quantity of inventory items, which the system calculates automatically, for the document.

controlQuantity.description: The manually entered quantity of inventory items.??Control Qty.??is available only if the??Validate Document Totals on Entry??option is selected on the??Inventory Preferences??form. If the??Control Qty.??and??Total Qty.values do not match, the system generates a warning message and the issue cannot be saved.

batchNumber.description: The reference number of the batch generated for the receipt. Click the number to open the??Journal Transactions??(GL.30.10.00) form and view the details of the transactions.

lastModifiedDateTime.description: The date when the document was last modified.

controlAmount.description: The top part > Control amount > The manually entered summary amount for all specified inventory items.??Control Amount??is available only if the??Validate Document Totals on Entry??option is selected on the??Inventory Preferences??form. If the??Control Amount??and??Total Amount??values do not match, the system generates a warning message and the issue cannot be saved.

referenceNumber.description: The unique reference number of the receipt, which the system automatically assigns according to the numbering sequence selected for receipts on the??Inventory Preferences??IN.10.10.00) form.

status.description:
The current status of the receipt. The following options are available: 
On Hold:The receipt/issue is a draft and can be edited. Receipts with this status cannot be released.
Balanced: The receipt/issue data has been validated by the system and the receipt can be released. It also can be modified or deleted, but changes can be saved only if the receipt is balanced.
Released: The receipt/issue has been released and cannot be edited or deleted.

hold.description: A check box that you select to give the receipt the??On Hold??status. Clear the check box to save the receipt with the??Balanced??status.

The user enters this value manually to confirm the total cost as calculated automatically for the document. If the??Control Cost??and??Total Cost??values do not match, the system generates a warning message and the document cannot be saved.

On Hold:The receipt/issue is a draft and can be edited. Receipts with this status cannot be released.
Balanced: The receipt/issue data has been validated by the system and the receipt can be released. It also can be modified or deleted, but changes can be saved only if the receipt is balanced.
Released: The receipt/issue has been released and cannot be edited or deleted.

hold.description: A check box that you select to give the receipt the??On Hold??status. Clear the check box to save the receipt with the??Balanced??status.

InventorySummaryDto.description: This class represents a InventorySummary in InventorySummaryController. Used by getting data.

available.description: The table > Available > The quantity of the stock items available at the specific warehouse and location.

availableForShipment.description: The table > Available for shipment > The quantity of the stock items available at the specific warehouse and location calculated based on the quantity on hand with the quantities shipped and on shipping deducted.

notAvailable.description: The table > Not available > The quantity of the stock items on locations for which the Include in qty. available option is not selected.

soBooked.description: The table > Sales order booked > The quantity of the stock items booked according to sales orders.

soAllocated.description: The table > Sales order allocated > The quantity of stock items set aside according to sales orders.

soShipped.description: The table > Sales orders shipped > The quantity of the stock items shipped according to the confirmed shipments.

soBackOrdered.description: The table > Back orders > The quantity of the stock items on sales orders with the Back order status.

inIssues.description: The table > Inventory issues > The quantity of the stock items included in the inventory issue documents that have not yet been released.

inReceipts.description: The table > Invnetory receipts > The quantity of the stock items included in the inventory receipt documents that have not yet been released.

inTransit.description: The table > In transit > The quantity of the stock items included as in transit quantities in the inventory transfer documents that have not yet been released.

inAssemblyDemand.description: The table > In assembly demand > The quantity of the stock items included in unreleased kit assembly documents as components or kits, depending on whether the item is a kit or a kit component.

inAssemblySupply.description: The table > In assembly supply > The quantity of the stock items listed on unreleased kit assembly documents.

purchasePrepared.description: The table > Purchase prepared > The quantity of the stock items listed on purchase orders pending approval and on hold.

purchaseOrders.description: The table > Purchase orders > The quantity of the stock items included in open purchase orders. To view the purchase orders, open the Purchase orders (PO301000) window.

poReceipts.description: The table > Purchase order receipts > The quantity of the stock items included in the purchase receipts that have not yet been released. To view the purchase receipts, open the Purchase receipts (PO302000) window.

expired.description: The table > Expired > The quantity of the stock items that has reached its expiration date.

onHand.description: The table > On hand > The quantity of the stock items available on hand at the specified warehouse and location.

soToPurchase.description: The table > Sales order to purchase > The quantity of the stock items included in unreleased sales orders requiring creating purchase orders.

purchaseForSO.description: The table > Purchase for sales order. > The quantity of the stock items listed on open purchase orders created for sales orders.

purchaseForSOPrepared.description: The table > Purchase for sales order prepared > The quantity of the stock items listed on purchase orders yet on hold or pending approval and created for back orders.

purchaseForSOReceipts.description: The table > Purchase for sales order receipts > The quantity of the stock items listed on purchase receipts for orders that were created for sales orders.

soToDropShip.description: The table > Sales order to drop-ship > The quantity of the stock items included in open purchase orders created for drop-ship orders.

dropShipForSO.description: The table > Drop-ship for sales order > The quantity of the stock items listed on open drop-ship orders. This value is not included in the quantity available.

dropShipForSOPrepared.description: The table > Drop-ship for sales order, prepared > The quantity of the stock items listed on drop-ship sales orders with a status of On hold or Pending approval; this value is not included in the quantity available.

dropShipForSOReceipts.description: The table > Drop-ship for sales order, receipts > The quantity of the stock items listed on receipts for drop-ship sales orders; this value is not included in the quantity available.

baseUnit.description: The table > Base unit > The unit of measure (UoM) selected as the base unit for the stock items in the Stock items (IN202500) window.

estimatedUnitCost.description: The table > Estimated unit cost > The estimated unit cost of the selected stock items.

estimatedTotalCost.description: The table > Estimated total cost > The estimated total cost of the stock items available at the specified warehouse and location.

JournalTransactionDto.description: This class represents a journal transaction in JournalTransactionController. Used by getting data.

module.description: The top part > Workspace > The workspace where the batch originates. New batches can be created only for General ledger.

batchNumber.description: The top part > Batch number > The unique ID of the batch, which is generated by the numbering sequence assigned to batches in the GL102000 window.

status.description: The top part > Status > The current status of the batch. The status defines what processing can be applied to the batch. The following options are available: On hold, Balanced, Scheduled, Unposted, Posted, Void.

hold.description: The top part > Hold > A check box that indicates (if selected) that the batch has the On hold status and cannot be released or posted. You can clear the check box only if the batch has total debits equal to total credits.

transactionDate.description: Mandatory field: The top part > Transaction date* > The date when the batch was created, which relates to the transaction dates of the journal entries.

postPeriod.description: Mandatory field: The top part > Post period* > The financial period to which the transactions recorded in the document should be posted. Format MMYYYY.

financialPeriod.description: Mandatory field: The top part Post period* > The financial period to which the transactions should be posted. Format YYYYMM.

ledger.description: Mandatory field: The top part > Ledger* > The unique ID of the ledger to which batch transactions are posted. By default, it is the default posting ledger specified for the branch in the GL101010 window, but another posting ledger can be selected.

ledgerDescription.description: Mandatory field: The top part > Ledger* > Click the magnifier > The description of the ledger to which batch transactions are posted. By default, it is the default posting ledger specified for the branch in the GL101010 window, but another posting ledger can be selected.

currencyId.description: The top part > Currency > The currency used for all the journal transactions in the selected batch.

exchangeRate.description: Ingformation collected from the system to calculate currency amount.

autoReversing.description: The top part > Automatic reversing > A check box that indicates (if selected) that the batch is auto-reversing.

reversingEntry.description: The top part > Reversing entry > A check box that indicates (if selected) that the batch is a reversing batch. The Orig.batch number field displays the ID of the batch that was reversed by this batch.

description.description: The top part > Description > A description of the batch.

originalBatchNumber.description: The top part > Orig. batch number > For a scheduled or auto-reversing batch, the reference number of the batch used as a template.

debitTotal.description: The top part > Debit total > The total of transaction debit amounts for the batch; the value is calculated automatically.

debitTotalInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Debit total in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

creditTotal.description: The top part > Credit total > The total of transaction credit amounts for the batch; the value is calculated automatically.

creditTotalInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Credit total in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in a another currency than your default.

controlTotal.description: The top part > Control total > The control total of the batch, which is used for batch status validation.

controlTotalInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Control total in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

endDate.description: Summary tab > Project properties section > End date > The date when the project is expected to end.

autoAllocate.description: Summary tab > Invoicing and allocation settings section > Run allocation when you release project transactions > A check box that indicates (if selected) that allocation is run automatically during the release of the documents associated with this project.

automaticReleaseAr.description: Summary tab > Invoicing and allocation settings section > Automatically release customer documents > A check box that indicates (if selected) that invoice documents are released automatically after the project invoicing is completed.

uom.description: UoM > The unit of measure used to estimate the quantity for the transaction, such as HOUR or BOX.

quantity.description: Quantity > 	The quantity for the transaction, such as the number of service hours provided to the customer.

unitRate.description: Unit rate > The price of the item or the rate of the service.

amount.description: Amount > The amount of the transaction.

billable.description: Invoiceable > A check box indicating whether the transaction is used in calculating the amount charged to the customer for the project task.

released.description: Released > A check box indicating whether the transaction has been released.

allocated.description: Allocated > A check box that indicates whether the amounts of the transactions were allocated for the project.

billableQuantity.description: Qty. that can be invoiced > The total invoiceable quantity for the transactions listed in the table.

financialPeriod.description: Period > The financial period associated with the transaction.

batchNbr.description: Batch no. > The batch number of the transaction in the General ledger workspace.

useBillableQty.description: Use the quantity that can be invoiced in the amount formula > A check box that you select if you want the system to use the invoiceable quantity (the Invoiceable quantity column) instead of the overall quantity (the Quantity column) of the transaction when calculating the amount of transaction.

startDate.description: Start date > The start date for this transaction.

endDate.description: End date > The end date for this transaction

lastModifiedDateTime.description: System generated information

overtimeMultiplier.description: Multiplier > The multiplier by which the unit rate is multiplied when the labour cost is calculated.

refNbr.description: The top part > Ref. no. > The reference number of the transaction.

description.description: The top part > Description > The description provided for the transaction.

origDocNbr.description: The top part > Orig. doc. no. > The reference number of the underlying document for the transaction.

status.description: The top part > Status > The status of the transaction. The following statuses are possible: Balanced, Released.

module.description: The top part > Module > The module you create the transactions in.

origDocType.description: The top part > Orig. doc. no. > The type of the document the transaction is based on. It has one of the following values: Allocation, Time card, Case, Expense claim, Allocation reversal, Reversal, Credit note.

receiptNumber.description: The top part > Receipt no. > The unique reference number of the purchase receipt, transfer receipt, or return, which the system automatically assigns according to its number series.

status.description: The top part > Status > The current status of the purchase or transfer receipt, or return, which the system assigns automatically.

supplierName.description: The top part > Supplier > The supplier from which the items have been received or to which they will be returned.

currency.description: The top part > Currency > The currency the supplier uses for invoicing.

totalQty.description: The top part > Total qty. > The total quantity of items received from or returned to the supplier; the sum of all quantities of all stock items listed on the Document details tab.

totalAmt.description: The top part > Total amt. > The total amount calculated for items received from or returned to the supplier; the sum of all amounts of all stock items listed on the Document details tab.

PurchaseOrderLineDto.description: This class represents a Purchase Order Line in PurchaseOrderController. Used for getting data.

lineType.description: Line type > 	The type of the order line, which can be one of the following options: Goods for inventory, Non-stock, Service, Freight, Good for sales order, Non-stock for drop-ship, Drop-ship, Goods for RP, Description.

lineDescription.description: A description of the order line, which is copied from the item's description.

uom.description: UoM > The unit of measure (UoM) in which the quantity of the item is specified.

orderQty.description: Order qty. > The quantity of the item that has been ordered.

qtyOnReceipts.description: Qty. on receipts > The quantity of the item that has been received according to all receipts, including the unreleased ones.

unitCost.description: Unit cost > The cost per UoM of the stock item.

unitCostInBaseCurrency.description: Background calculation connected with the View base/View currency function in the top part. Changes the values in Unit cost, Amount, Disc. unit cost and Cost fields.

extCost.description: Ext. cost > The extended cost of the item, which is the unit cost multiplied by the quantity.

discountPercent.description: Discount percent > If the Supplier customer discounts functionality is enabled in the Enable/disable functionalities (CS100000) window, the percent of the discount that has been entered manually or calculated based on the discount amount entered manually for this line item.

discountAmount.description: Discount amount > If the Supplier customer discounts functionality is enabled in the Enable/disable functionalities (CS100000) window, the amount of the discount that has been specified manually or calculated based on the discount percent entered manually.

manualDiscount.description: Manual discount > A check box that indicates (if selected) that the discount has been applied manually.

amount.description: Amount > The amount calculated (after the discount has been taken) for the item.

receivedAmt.description: Received amt. > The amount received on this purchase order for this item.

alternateId.description: Alternate ID > The alternate ID used for this stock item-subitem pair by the supplier.

minReceipt.description: Min. receipt (%) > The minimum quantity of the item, expressed as a percentage of the ordered quantity, that is required for the item to be accepted at the warehouse if the Receipt action is Rejected.

maxReceipt.description: Max. receipt (%) > The maximum quantity of the item, expressed as a percentage of the ordered quantity, that is required for the item to be accepted at the warehouse if the Receipt action is Rejected.

completeOn.description: Complete on (%) > The minimum percentage of the ordered quantity for the stock item that must be received to complete the purchase order line (gets the default value from the Threshold receipt (%) setting of the supplier in the (AP303000) window).

receiptAction.description: Receipt action > The action that should be perform when the ordered item is received if its quantity is greater than the Max. receipt value or less than the Min. receipt value calculated based on the line's ordered quantity. Values: Reject, Accept but warn, Accept.

requested.description: Requested > The date when the item was requested.

promised.description: Promised > The date when the item's deliver was promised.

completed.description: Completed > A check box that indicates (if selected) that the purchasing of the item requested by this line of the purchase order has been completed.

canceled.description: Cancelled > A check box that indicates (if selected) that this line of the purchase order has been cancelled.

orderType.description: Order type > The order type this order is related to (for normal orders based on blanket or standard orders).

orderNumber.description: Order no. > 	The reference number of the blanket or standard order (for normal orders based on blanket or standard orders).

note.description: Table > Icon Notes > Pop-up window for providing any user-defined text connected to the order.

skipDiscount.description: The table > Skip discount > A check box that you select to cancel a Group or Document level discount for the document.

discountCode.description: Mandatory field: The table > Discount code* > The discount code of the supplier discount applied to the document automatically or manually.

sequanceID.description: Mandatory field: The table > Series ID* > The ID of the discount sequence applied to the document.

type.description: The table > Type > The type of discount applied to the document (Group or Document).

manualDiscount.description: The table > Manual discount > A check box that indicates (if selected) that the supplier discount shown in this row has been applied manually .

discountableAmt.description: The table > Discountable amt. > The amount used as a base for discount calculation if the discount is defined as based on the amount.

discountableQty.description: The table > Discountable qty. > The quantity used as a base for discount calculation if the discount is defined as based on the item quantity.

discountAmt.description: The table > Discount amt. > The amount of the discount.

discount.description: The table > Discount percent > The discount percent if by definition the discount is calculated as a percentage.

freeItem.description: The table > Free item > The item ID of the free item, if one is specified by the discount applied to the document.

freeItemQty.description: The table > Free item qty.> The quantity of the free item to be added as the discount.

addressLine2.description: Address 2 > The second line of the address.

PurchaseOrderDto.description: This class represents a Purchase Order in PurchaseOrderController. Used for getting data.

shippingDestinationType.description: Shipping instructions tab > The Delivery address section > Shipping destination type > The type of the shipping destination, which is one of the following options: Branch location (meaning a branch of your company), Customer, Supplier, and Warehouse.

fobPoint.description: Delivery instructions tab > The Delivery instructions section > FOB point > The FOB point where the title of goods (listed on this purchase order) is transferred from the supplier to the company.

shipVia.description: Delivery instructions tab > The Delivery instructions section > Ship via > The carrier selected to ship the goods for the purchase order.

shipTerms.description: Delivery instructions tab > The Delivery instructions section > Shipping terms > The shipping terms for the purchase order.

salesOrderType.description: Other information tab > Sales order type > The type of the sales order associated with the purchase order.

salesOrderNbr.description: Other information tab > Sales order no. > The ID of the sales order associated with the purchase order.

requisitionRefNbr.description: Other information tab > Requisition ref. no. > The reference number of the requisition document associated with the purchase order, if any.

paymentRefNbr.description: Other information tab > Prepayment ref. no. > The reference number of the prepayment request linked to this purchase order, if any.

workgroupID.description: Other information tab > Work group ID > The work group to which the purchase order was assigned for processing.

dontPrint.description: Other information > Do not print > A check box that indicates (if selected) that the current purchase order should not be printed.

printed.description: Other information > Printed > A check box that indicates (if selected) that the current purchase order was printed.

dontEmail.description: Other information > Do not email > A check box that indicates (if selected) indicates that the purchase order should not be emailed.

emailed.description: Other information > Emailed > A check box that indicates (if selected) indicates that the current purchase order was emailed.

openQuantity.description: Other information > Open Quantity > The difference between the quantities of ordered and received items.

openBalance.description: Other information > Open amount > The amount of these items that are ordered but not received.

orderType.description: The top part > Type > The type of the purchase order, which can be one of these options: Normal, Drop-ship, Blanket, Default

orderNbr.description: The top part > Order no. > The unique reference number of the purchase order, which the system assigns based on the number series assigned to purchase orders of this type, as specified in the PO101000 window.

hold.description: The top part > Hold > A check box that you select to give the purchase order the On hold status.

status.description: The top part > Status > The system-generated status of the purchase order, which can be one of the following options: On hold, Open, Pending approval, Rejected, Pending printing, Pending e-mail, Closed, Cancelled.

date.description: Mandatory field: The top part > Date* > The date when the purchase order was created.

promisedOn.description: The top part > Delivery date > The date when the supplier promised that the items listed in the order will be received at their destination location.

description.description: The top part > Description > A brief description of the purchase order.

currency.description: The top part > Currency > The currency the purchase order will be paid in.

supplierRef.description: The top part > Supplier ref. > The reference number of the supplier document related to this purchase order.

lineTotal.description: The top part > Line total > The total sum of the Extended amount entries for all lines in the current purchase order. This value is calculated by the system and users cannot manually change it.

lineTotalInBaseCurrency.description: The top part > View base > A button that recalculates the Line total to your base currency if the amount on the purchase order is in another currency then base currency. When you click the button, the button toggles to View currency.

vatExemptTotal.description: The Top part > VAT exempt total > The document total that is exempt from VAT. This total is calculated as the taxable amount for the VAT with the Include in VAT exempt total check box selected in the TX205000 window.

vatExemptTotalInBaseCurrency.description: The top part > View base > A button that recalculates the VAT exempt total to your base currency if the amount on the purchase order is in another currency then base currency. When you click the button, the button toggles to View currency.

taxTotal.description: The Top part > VAT total > The total VAT amount for all lines added to the current purchase order. This value, also calculated by the system, is the sum of the VAT amounts for each line.

taxTotalInBaseCurrency.description: The top part > View base > A button that recalculates the VAT total to your base currency if the amount on the purchase order is in another currency then base currency. When you click the button, the button toggles to View currency.

orderTotal.description: The Top part > Order total > The total sum for the purchase order, including VAT. This read-only value is the sum of the Line total and VAT total values.

orderTotalInBaseCurrency.description: The top part > View base > A button that recalculates the Order total to your base currency if the amount on the purchase order is in another currency then base currency. When you click the button, the button toggles to View currency.

controlTotal.description: The top part > Control total > The order's total amount (including VAT), which you must enter manually when you attempt to save the order with the Balanced status.

controlTotalInBaseCurrency.description: The top part > View base > A button that recalculates the Control total to your base currency if the amount on the purchase order is in another currency then base currency. When you click the button, the button toggles to View currency.

PurchaseOrderBasicDto.description: This class represents a Purchase Order in PurchaseOrderController. Used for getting data.

orderType.description: The top part > Type > The type of the purchase order, which can be one of these options: Normal, Drop-ship, Blanket, Default

orderNbr.description: The top part > Order no. > The unique reference number of the purchase order, which the system assigns based on the number series assigned to purchase orders of this type, as specified in the PO101000 window.

hold.description: The top part > Hold > A check box that you select to give the purchase order the On hold status.

status.description: The top part > Status > The system-generated status of the purchase order, which can be one of the following options: On hold, Open, Pending approval, Rejected, Pending printing, Pending e-mail, Closed, Cancelled.

date.description: Mandatory field: The top part > Date* > The date when the purchase order was created.

promisedOn.description: The top part > Delivery date > The date when the supplier promised that the items listed in the order will be received at their destination location.

description.description: The top part > Description > A brief description of the purchase order.

currency.description: The top part > Currency > The currency the purchase order will be paid in.

supplierRef.description: The top part > Supplier ref. > The reference number of the supplier document related to this purchase order.

lineTotal.description: The top part > Line total > The total sum of the Extended amount entries for all lines in the current purchase order. This value is calculated by the system and users cannot manually change it.

lineTotalInBaseCurrency.description: The top part > View base > A button that recalculates the Line total to your base currency if the amount on the purchase order is in another currency then base currency. When you click the button, the button toggles to View currency.

vatExemptTotal.description: The Top part > VAT exempt total > The document total that is exempt from VAT. This total is calculated as the taxable amount for the VAT with the Include in VAT exempt total check box selected in the TX205000 window.

taxTotal.description: The Top part > VAT total > The total VAT amount for all lines added to the current purchase order. This value, also calculated by the system, is the sum of the VAT amounts for each line.

taxTotalInBaseCurrency.description: The top part > View base > A button that recalculates the VAT total to your base currency if the amount on the purchase order is in another currency then base currency. When you click the button, the button toggles to View currency.

orderTotal.description: The Top part > Order total > The total sum for the purchase order, including VAT. This read-only value is the sum of the Line total and VAT total values.

orderTotalInBaseCurrency.description: The top part > View base > A button that recalculates the Order total to your base currency if the amount on the purchase order is in another currency then base currency. When you click the button, the button toggles to View currency.

controlTotal.description: The top part > Control total > The order's total amount (including VAT), which you must enter manually when you attempt to save the order with the Balanced status.

controlTotalInBaseCurrency.description: The top part > View base > A button that recalculates the Control total to your base currency if the amount on the purchase order is in another currency then base currency. When you click the button, the button toggles to View currency.

controlTotal.description: The top part > Control amt. > The total amount of the receipt or return, which you manually enter.

ShipmentDto.description: This class represents a Shipment in ShipmentController. Used by getting data.

shipmentNumber.description: The top part > Shipment no > The unique reference number of the document, which is automatically generated by the system.

shipmentType.description: The top part > Type > The type of the shipment document, which can be one of the following options: Shipment, Transfer.

status.description: The top part > Status > The status of the document.

hold.description: The top part > Hold > This check box indicates (if selected) that the documents cannot be processed further until the check box is cleared.

operation.description: The top part > Operation > The operation to be performed in the Inventory workspace for this shipment: Issue or Receipt.

shipmentDate.description: Mandatory field: The top part > Shipment date* > The date when the document has been created.

currencyId.description: Delivery settings tab > Freight currency > By default, it is the currency of the sales order, but you can change it if needed.

shippedQuantity.description: The top part > Shipped quantity > The quantity of goods shipped.

shippedWeight.description: The top part > Shipped weight > The weight of the goods shipped.

shippedVolume.description: The top part > Shipped volume > The total volume of the items in the shipment.

packages.description: The top part > Packages > The number of boxes included in this shipment.

packagesWeight.description: The top part > Package weight > The total weight of the shipment that includes the weight of boxes (for boxes determined automatically).

controlQuantity.description: The top part > Control quantity > The control value, which you manually enter as a value equal to the shipped quantity if the Validate shipment total on confirmation check box has been selected in the Sales orders preferences (SO101000) window.

residentialDelivery.description: Delivery settings tab > Shipping information section > Residential delivery > This check box indicates (if selected) that the shipping address is a residential one.

saturdayDelivery.description: Delivery settings tab > Shipping information section > Saturday delivery > This check box indicates delivery on saturday.

insurance.description: Delivery settings tab > Shipping information section > Insurance > This check box indicates (if selected) that insurance is required for the shipment.

freightCost.description: Delivery settings tab > Shipping information section > Freight cost > The freight cost of the shipment.

freightAmt.description: Delivery settings tab > Shipping information section > Freight amt. > The amount of freight the customer will be charged for the shipment.

container.description: Delivery settings tab > Intrastat section > Container > This check box indicates (if selected) that the shipment gets marked as shipped in container for Intrastat reporting purposes.

SupplierInvoiceDto.description: This class represents a ApInvoice in SupplierInvoiceController. Used by getting data.

hold.description: The Top part > Hold > A check box that indicates that the status of the supplier ledger document is On hold.

exchangeRate.description: The Top part > Currency > The currency of the document.

paymentRefNo.description: The Top part > Payment ref.no > The payment reference number of the document.

retainageApply.description: The Top part > Apply retainage > A check box that indicates (if selected) that this invoice is an invoice with retainage.

cashDiscountDate.description: The Top part > Cash discount date > The end date of the cash discount period, which the system calculates by using the supplier's credit terms.

detailTotal.description: The Top part > Detail total > The document total as specified in the Document details tab.

detailTotalInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Detail total in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

discountTotal.description: The Top part > Discount total > The discount total calculated for the document. This total includes discounts of the Group and Document levels.

discountTotalInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Discount total in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

vatTaxableTotal.description: The Top part > VAT taxable total > The document total that is subjected to VAT.

vatTaxableTotalInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the VAT taxable total in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

vatExemptTotal.description: The Top part > VAT exempt total > The document total that is exempt from VAT.

vatExemptTotalInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the VAT exempt total in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

withholdingTax.description: The Top part > With. tax > The amount of withholding tax calculated for the document, if applicable.

withholdingTaxInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the With. tax in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

buyerReference.description: The Top part > Supplier ref. > The document's original reference number as assigned by the supplier (for informational purposes).

roundingDiff.description: The Top part > Rounding diff. > The difference between the original invoice amount (including the VAT amount calculated by the system) and rounded invoice amount (including the VAT amount modified by a user for VAT-inclusive items).

roundingDiffInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Rounding diff. in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

amount.description: The Top part > Amount > The amount to be paid for the document. Equal to the amount (or to the sum of amounts) shown in the Amount column of the Document details tab.

vatAmount.description: The Top part > VAT amount > The VAT amount to be paid for the document. Enter this amount manually according to the VAT amount specified in the original document.

taxCalculationMode.description: The Financial details tab > The VAT section > VAT calculation mode > The VAT calculation mode, which defines which amounts (VAT-inclusive or VAT-exclusive) should be entered in the detail lines of a document (TaxSetting, Gross, Net)

paySelected.description: The Financial details tab > The Payment information section > Approved for payment > When set to true indicates that the document is approved for payment.

documentType.description: The top part > Top part > Type > The type of the document. The following types are available: Purchase invoice, credit adjustment, purchase credit note, prepayment.

postPeriod.description: The Top part > Post period* > The post period of the payment document. Format MMYYYY.

financialPeriod.description: The financial period to which the transactions recorded in the document should be posted. Format YYYYMM.

date.description: The Top part > Date* > The date of the original supplier ledger document; by default, it is the current date, which can be changed.

origInvoiceDate.description: The Top part > OrigInvoiceDate* > The original invoice date of the original supplier ledger document; by default, it is the current date, which can be changed.

dueDate.description: The Top part > Due date* > The date when payment for the document is due in accordance with the supplier's credit terms.

approvalStatus.description: The Top part > Approval status > The status of the document in Visma.net Approval. [New, Canceled, SentToApproval, ReceivedByApproval, InProgressApproval, RejectedInApproval, ApprovedInApproval, ActiveWorkflowApproval.

status.description: The Top part > Document status > A read-only field that shows the status of the supplier ledger document:[Hold, Balanced, Voided, Scheduled, Open, Closed, Printed, Prebooked, Reserved]

currencyId.description: The Top part > Currency > The currency of the document.

balance.description: The Top part > Balance > The balance of the supplier ledger document after VAT (if inclusive) and the discount as specified in the tabs below.

balanceInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Balance in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

cashDiscount.description: The Top part > Cash discount > The cash discount amount that has been or will be taken in the document, which the system calculates based in the specified credit terms.

cashDiscountInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the Cash discount in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

supplierReference.description: The Top part > Supplier ref. > The document's original reference number as assigned by the supplier (for informational purposes).

description.description: The Top part > Description > A user-provided description for this supplier ledger document.

note.description: The table > Document details tab and Applications tab > Icon Notes > Pop-up window for providing any user-defined text connected with to invoice.

vatTotal.description: The Top part > VAT total > The total amount of tax paid in the document.

vatTotalInCurrency.description: Background calculation giving you the VAT total in your default currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.

payDate.description: The Financial details tab > The Payment information section > Pay date* > The date when the invoice should be paid. The date is the difference between the document due date or discount date and the number of days specified in the Payment lead time field in AP303000.

paymentMessage.description: The Financial details tab > The Payment information section > Payment message > The message connected with the payment.

cashAccount.description: Financial details tab > The payment information section > Cash account > The cash account associated with the payment method.

purchaseType.description:
PurchaseTye can be either {Visma.net.ERP.Web.Api.Model.V1.Enum.PurchaseType.PurchaseOrder} or {Visma.net.ERP.Web.Api.Model.V1.Enum.PurchaseType.PurchaseReceipt}<para>
It should be noted that for stock-items, its only limited to {Visma.net.ERP.Web.Api.Model.V1.Enum.PurchaseType.PurchaseReceipt}, however,
for non-stock items we can choose either {Visma.net.ERP.Web.Api.Model.V1.Enum.PurchaseType.PurchaseReceipt} or {Visma.net.ERP.Web.Api.Model.V1.Enum.PurchaseType.PurchaseOrder}</para>
